        writeTo

  Source   Edit

ImStyle is a library that helps you to manage your Dear ImGui application's style. Load the style from a niprefs file rather than hard-coding it into your app. Using ImStyle also allows you to change your app's style without compiling it again (since the style is read from a file).

Without ImStyle you need to set the style from code:

import nimgl/imgui
...
var style = igGetStyle()
style.alpha = 1f
style.windowPadding = ImVec2(x: 4f, y: 4f)
style.windowMenuButtonPosition = ImGuiDir.Left
style.colors[ord Text] = ImVec4(x: 0f, y: 0f, z: 0f, w: 1f) # RGBA
...
Using ImStyle you need to create a niprefs file (e.i.: style.niprefs), that will look like:

# ImStyle
alpha = 1 # -> 1f
windowPadding = [4, 4] # -> ImVec2(x: 4f, y: 4f)
windowMenuButtonPosition = "Left" # Or 0
colors=>
 Text = "#000000" # or "rgb(0, 0, 0)" or [0, 0, 0]
And load it in your code:

import imstyle
...
setIgStyle("style.niprefs")
...

proc toString(style: ImGuiStyle; colorProc: proc (col: ImVec4): PrefsNode = proc (
    col: ImVec4): PrefsNode = result = newPNode(col)): string {.discardable,
    ...raises: [ValueError, InvalidKey], tags: [].}
Convert style to a niprefs representation. Use colorProc to change the color format, for example to write hex using chroma: proc(col: ImVec4): PrefsNode = color(col.x, col.y, col.z, col.w).toHex().newPNode().   Source   Edit 
proc writeTo(style: ImGuiStyle; path: string) {.
    ...raises: [IOError, ValueError, InvalidKey], tags: [WriteIOEffect].}
Write style.toString() to path.   Source   Edit
